data.title: ubports/kernel_krillin: Linux kernel for BQ Aquaris E4.5 Ubuntu Edition
data.meta_description: Linux kernel for BQ Aquaris E4.5 Ubuntu Edition . Contribute to ubports/kernel_krillin development by creating an account on GitHub.
data.text:
Linux Kernel source code for the device bq Aquaris E4.5 Ubuntu Edition

Your Ubuntu environment is expected to contain a similar setup to that used for flashing ubuntu devices (see 1, installing phablet-tools ppa). You will need at least two other components installed:

If you are not using Xenial (16.04) but a more recent version of Ubuntu, the above command will not work: just install

and get the Android ARM compiler from upstream. Note that you need to pick an older version of the toolchain, as newer ones do not contain gcc (they come with clang only). It has been verified that the version tagged android-6.0.1_r21 works; you can download it from here. After unpacking it:

You also need to have python2.7 as your default python interpreter; see this question and the realted answer for a suggestion on how to set it up.

Specific sources are organised by branch and comments in the commits. First, you should clone the project:

After it, choose the branch you would like to build:

Then, build the kernel:

You can build a flashable image with

You can flash this with:
